reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening Health Systems and Scaling up Prevention and Treatment of Malaria in Sudan

description.narrative: Sudan - Malaria - Federal Ministry of Health of the Republic of Sudan - MOH. This program has the following goals: Reduce malaria morbidity and mortality by 30% by 2025 (taking 2020 as a base line) and accelerate efforts towards malaria elimination where feasible. The objectives of this program are: To ensure universal coverage of at risk population with appropriate vector control management as per operational stratification (with LLINs, IRS or LSM) and to maximize LLIN utilization rates from less than 50% (MIS 2016) to more than 85%. To ensure universal access of malaria patients to quality-assured malaria case management (testing, treatment) and to encourage early care seeking within 24 hours of fever onset. To control malaria in pregnancy including its effects on low birth weight through case management, distribution and replacement of LLINs to all pregnant women in LLIN targeted areas and, IPTp in stratum 5 and 6. To provide timely and reliable information for monitoring progress, trends in malaria cases and deaths and early detection and response to epidemics

title.narrative: Impact indicator for SDN-M-MOH
Malaria test positivity rate
Reported malaria cases (presumed and confirmed)
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
Malaria parasite prevalence: Proportion of children aged 6-59 months with malaria infection
Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Maternal mortality ratio, per 100,000 population
Neonatal mortality rate, per 100,000 population
Under 5 mortality rate per 1000 live births
Coverage / Output indicator for SDN-M-MOH
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Timeliness of facility reporting: Percentage of submitted facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are received on time per the national guidelines
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Completeness of facility reporting: Percentage of expected facility monthly reports (for the reporting period) that are actually received
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Proportion of households in targeted areas that received Indoor Residual Spraying during the reporting period
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Percentage of health facilities with essential medicines and life-saving commodities in stock
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
Proportion of population protected by IRS within the last 12 months in areas targeted for IRS
Outcome indicator for SDN-M-MOH
Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of population with access to an ITN within their household
Proportion of population using an insecticide-treated net among those with access to an insecticide-treated net
Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Percentage of existing ITNs used the previous night
Proportion of households sprayed by IRS within the last 12 months
Percentage of births attended by skilled health professional
Percentage of women attending antenatal care
